column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug because of a 15 year losing fight with chronic pancreatitus no D.R can tell me what it is the cause but they all have tried ther best. I have never ben a drinker or drug user I'm on 15 difrient meds like zofran,reglan and now this drug with has been the worst of them all I have 90% of all the side effects witch have been worse than the nausa the shaking,not sleeping,agression,trouble swalling, very hard time talking the word's just wont come out hard time passing pee, verry dark urin,sour throat weeknes of the mussles, confusion, gut wrenching nausa vomiting non stop confusion and bad sweeting I find myself faling unable to stay awake at home and at work this med has had more of a negative effect than a helpful effect Im sure that for some people this drug works well but to all who take it watch for and study the side effects they can be verry bad for you'r well being

column1: Nausea and Vomiting caused by Cancer Drugs

column2: TatorTot, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this for about a month now for nausea/vomiting. I have yet to get a diagnosis but my doctor told me to take this in the meantime. I've had no side effects at all.  This was truly a lifesaver. My nausea/vomiting is completely gone when I take 1 dose (10mg) of this once a day. I can now function like a normal person instead of living in fear of possibly vomiting in public or at work which I was doing before taking this medication. I guess I do have 1 side effect & that is constipation but if you take Senna, you should be fine. I also do not know the difference between Edisylate & Maleate for this medication so I'm documenting this comment under both. My prescription bottle just has the abbreviation of Prochlorper & that's it. Otherwise, I would totally recommend this to people having the same issues as I was.

column2: sararocks, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I use this medication for nausea that comes with my migrane headaches. Its also very effective for nausea caused by the hydrocodone I take for the pain. The hardest thing is getting it down my throat but its very effective !

column9: Having used this medicine since childhood, I can't give it a totally bad rating. However, since being diagnosed with MS, this is NOT a good medicine to use for severe nausea. i am on Tysabri and Lyrica for the MS havin severe nausea as a side effect. I naturally turn to this medicine, it, unfortunately, makes it worse. I didn't see a category, so I thought I'd share a warning..
